result.rationale: This species is native to Lake Albert and Murchison Nile, including the delta. It has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 7,997 km<sup>2</sup>. There is a single threat-based location given its habitat is under pressure from habitat degradation and pollution from oil and gas developments (Wandera and Balirwa 2010) that can affect the entire population. These threats are projected to lead to a continuing decline in habitat quality. Therefore, it is assessed as Vulnerable.
result.geographicrange: This species is native to Lake Albert and Murchison Nile, including the delta. Recent records of the species are available at RMCA (Vranken et al. 2020).
result.population: No information is available on the population size and trend.
result.habitat: It is found both in the lake and river (Wandera and Balirwa 2010), but no additional information is available on its suitable habitat and ecological requirements.
result.threats: Habitat degradation due to activities in the catchment and pollution from oil and gas developments in the Albertine graben are threats (Wandera and Balirwa 2010).
result.conservationmeasures: Conservation actions are not known to be in place for this species.
result.usetrade: There is no use or trade information.
